review_blob: Poured from a bottle into a tumbler. A rich amber toffee colour with a small head that very quickly dissipates leaving some lacing. On the nose it has tropical fruit aromas and some piney resin hops, a very pleasant smelling apa. Taste is not as bitter as expected with nice malt and pleasant mouthfeel. Overall very sessionable and refreshing.

Rebadged from their recent marketing into a white labeled bottle. Poured from a 500ml bottle into a tulip. Amber in colour with high carbonation and a huge head. Marmalade is there all right with a bit of creamed Manuka honey on the nose. Has massive lacing. Taste, well it all goes downhill unfortunately, it is very sweet with a bit of bitterness that doesn't meld well. The bitterness stays on the palate but it's not a good feel. Very disappointing and won't be visited again.
beer_name: Harringtons Brewers Selection India Pale Ale

review_blob: Poured from a 500ml bottle. A beautiful golden colour with a good inch of solid head. Little lacing. First attempt at this style and impressed with a very interesting nose. Some citrus and sweetness as well as freshly baked brioche and cedar. Bitter with a heavy yeast flavour which dominates the hops, leaves a good mouthfeel and seems to be somewhat true to style from what I gather. Not sure it's my thing, but not discouraged by the experience.

Pours a very cloudy amber, typical bottle condition with massive head. All the typical IPA fruit and hop with hop on the nose. Not as bitter as I was expecting, has a great palate though and hides the higher alc well. Some lacing down. Great stuff from Dunedin's best brewery.
